name: Vietnamese Pork Meatballs in Tomato Sauce (Xíu Mại)
description: Xíu Mại is a Vietnamese dish of steamed or boiled pork meatballs made with ground pork, jicama, and optionally ground shrimp, simmered in a sweet and savory tomato sauce. Enjoy it in a Bánh Mì sandwich or simply with a baguette and a warm bowl of meatballs on the side for dipping.

recipeIngredient: Half cup yellow or white onion (finely diced)
2 teaspoons chicken or mushroom bouillon powder
1 green onion (thinly sliced; whites only; reserve green part for sauce)
Half cup yellow or white onion (finely diced)
1 teaspoon chicken or mushroom bouillon powder
recipeInstructions: Make the meatballs (assembly only): In a large bowl, combine all of the meatball ingredients. Mix well until everything is evenly combined. Shape the mixture into small balls, about 1-1/2 inches in diameter. Set aside.
Heat the vegetable oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add the garlic and onions. Cook until fragrant (about 1 minute).
Add the tomatoes and cook for about 3 minutes, or until they start to break down. Add chicken stock and bring the mixture to a low simmer.
Add meatballs, cover and simmer on medium low heat for 10-15 minutes.
Season tomato sauce to taste with sugar, bouillon powder, salt, fish sauce, and ground pepper.

If you want the sauce to be thicker, make the slurry. Combine potato starch and 3 tablespoons water and whisk until starch is completely dissolved. Add to the tomato sauce and continue cooking until the sauce slightly thickens (about 3 minutes).
Garnish with green part of green onions and serve.
